author: m.kalinin
content: Good idea! It should be an extension of the fork choice rule, and have `get_safe_head` function. But I am not sure whether it should be in the `/specs` folder or not as safe head is not a part of the core protocol. author: johns4
content: Is there anyone working on a UI which will help visualize whether the merge is successful? The UI would run locally and call local RPC APIs to show progress of the merge as well as info about CL/EL clients, stats from RPC APIs, etc. The UI could also double as a type of GUI to local CL/EL clients as well as a way to watch your CL/EL's transition during the merge successfully.

author: m.kalinin
content: I am not aware about any efforts on this kind of software. Are you about to work on anything like that?

author: johns4
content: Ok, good to know. Just started a week ago. Familiarizing myself with the RPC APIs and the merge transition steps.

content: I can share some mockups and screenshots with people soon, if anyone is interested.
